summary: Yakutsk is the capital of Sakha, Russia, and it's really cold! With an average annual temperature of -8.0°C (17.6°F), it's no wonder it's considered the coldest major city globally. Located near the Arctic Circle, this rapidly growing city has a population of over 350,000 people. The mining industry drives its economy. Yakutsk is unique as it's built on permafrost, and it's the largest city in this condition. It's also a significant port on the Lena River.
title: Yakutsk
